snippet: The Muslim Brotherhood nominated its chief strategist and financier Khairat el-Shater to become Egypt’s first president since Hosni Mubarak.
abstract: Muslim Brotherhood nominates its chief strategist and financier Khairat el-Shater to become Egypt’s first president since Hosni Mubarak, breaking pledge not to seek top office and monopoly on power; broken promise raises particular concerns in the United States and Israel, which considered the Mubarak government's commitment to the peace agreement a linchpin of regional stability.
lead_paragraph: The Muslim Brotherhood nominated its chief strategist and financier Khairat el-Shater to become Egypt’s first president since Hosni Mubarak.

headline.main: Islamist Group Breaks Pledge to Stay Out of Race in Egypt
headline.print_headline: Islamist Group Breaks Pledge In Egypt Race
